intro: Pseudolinosyris capusii, commonly known as the Cape Verde morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to blue flowers that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and twining. Pseudolinosyris capusii is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky soils.
